vulnerabilities.title: Improper Check for Dropped Privileges
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `bash` package. An issue was discovered in disable_priv_mode in shell.c in GNU Bash through 5.0 patch 11. By default, if Bash is run with its effective UID not equal to its real UID, it will drop privileges by setting its effective UID to its real UID. However, it does so incorrectly. On Linux and other systems that support "saved UID" functionality, the saved UID is not dropped. An attacker with command execution in the shell can use "enable -f" for runtime loading of a new builtin, which can be a shared object that calls setuid() and therefore regains privileges. However, binaries running with an effective UID of 0 are unaffected. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `bash`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200430-0003/) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-18276) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/bminor/bash/commit/951bdaad7a18cc0dc1036bba86b18b90874d39ff) - [MISC](http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/155498/Bash-5.0-Patch-11-Privilege-Escalation.html) - [MISC](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-wGtxJ8opa8) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-18276)
vulnerabilities.name: bash

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package. There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `binutils`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3487) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/3Z3KSJY3CLAAFFT7FNFCJOMDITPQGN56/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/Q6V2LF5AVOUTHPYY2O5TRNAIXVMXFDGL/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RNBNDMJWZOQYCEZXENHBSM6DBZ332UZZ/) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1947111)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package. The C++ symbol demangler routine in cplus-dem.c in libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation and application crash) via a crafted file, as demonstrated by a call from the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd). ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `binutils`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-13716) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22009) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-13716)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package. GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `binutils`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K05032915?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010204) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=23765) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190822-0001/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-1010204)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package. The demangle_template function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1, has a memory leak via a crafted string, leading to a denial of service (memory consumption), as demonstrated by cxxfilt, a related issue to CVE-2018-12698. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `binutils`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20657) - [BID](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106444) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K62602089) - [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=88539) - [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3352)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

The demangle_template function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1, has a memory leak via a crafted string, leading to a denial of service (memory consumption), as demonstrated by cxxfilt, a related issue to CVE-2018-12698. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `binutils`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20657) - [BID](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106444) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K62602089) - [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=88539) - [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3352)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/libbinutils

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package. There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `binutils`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3487) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/3Z3KSJY3CLAAFFT7FNFCJOMDITPQGN56/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/Q6V2LF5AVOUTHPYY2O5TRNAIXVMXFDGL/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RNBNDMJWZOQYCEZXENHBSM6DBZ332UZZ/) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1947111)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/libctf-nobfd0

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package. The C++ symbol demangler routine in cplus-dem.c in libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation and application crash) via a crafted file, as demonstrated by a call from the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd). ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `binutils`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-13716) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22009) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-13716)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/libctf-nobfd0

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package. GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `binutils`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K05032915?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010204) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=23765) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190822-0001/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-1010204)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/libctf-nobfd0

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `bison` package. GNU Bison before 3.7.1 has a use-after-free in _obstack_free in lib/obstack.c (called from gram_lex) when a '\0' byte is encountered. NOTE: there is a risk only if Bison is used with untrusted input, and the observed bug happens to cause unsafe behavior with a specific compiler/architecture. The bug report was intended to show that a crash may occur in Bison itself, not that a crash may occur in code that is generated by Bison. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `bison`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-24240) - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-24240) - [MISC](https://github.com/akimd/bison/commit/be95a4fe2951374676efc9454ffee8638faaf68d) - [MISC](https://github.com/akimd/bison/compare/v3.7...v3.7.1) - [MISC](https://lists.gnu.org/r/bug-bison/2020-07/msg00051.html)
vulnerabilities.name: bison
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: /bin/sh -c apt-get update -qqy && apt-get install --no-install-recommends -y     bc bison ca-certificates curl gcc git jq libxml2 libtinfo5 libc6-dev libssl-dev     libstdc++6 make openssl python-all-dev python3-dev ssh tzdata wget zip zstd     && apt-get -y clean && apt-get -y autoremove     && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists     && rm -rf /var/cache/apt/archives

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `coreutils` package. chroot in GNU coreutils, when used with --userspec, allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `coreutils`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-2781) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/02/28/2) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/02/28/3) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-2781)
vulnerabilities.name: coreutils

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `gcc-9` package. Arm Armv8-A core implementations utilizing speculative execution past unconditional changes in control flow may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis, aka "straight-line speculation." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `gcc-9`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13844) - [CONFIRM](http://lists.llvm.org/pipermail/llvm-dev/2020-June/142109.html) - [CONFIRM](https://developer.arm.com/support/arm-security-updates/speculative-processor-vulnerability) - [CONFIRM](https://developer.arm.com/support/arm-security-updates/speculative-processor-vulnerability/frequently-asked-questions) - [CONFIRM](https://gcc.gnu.org/pipermail/gcc-patches/2020-June/547520.html) - [MISC](https://developer.arm.com/support/arm-security-updates/speculative-processor-vulnerability/downloads/straight-line-speculation) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-10/msg00039.html) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-10/msg00040.html)
vulnerabilities.name: gcc-9/cpp-9

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `git` package. GIT version 2.15.1 and earlier contains a Input Validation Error vulnerability in Client that can result in problems including messing up terminal configuration to RCE. This attack appear to be exploitable via The user must interact with a malicious git server, (or have their traffic modified in a MITM attack). ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `git`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-1000021) - [http://www.batterystapl.es/2018/01/security-implications-of-ansi-escape.html](http://www.batterystapl.es/2018/01/security-implications-of-ansi-escape.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-1000021)
vulnerabilities.name: git/git-man
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: /bin/sh -c apt-get update -qqy && apt-get install --no-install-recommends -y     bc bison ca-certificates curl gcc git jq libxml2 libtinfo5 libc6-dev libssl-dev     libstdc++6 make openssl python-all-dev python3-dev ssh tzdata wget zip zstd     && apt-get -y clean && apt-get -y autoremove     && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists     && rm -rf /var/cache/apt/archives

vulnerabilities.title: Reachable Assertion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.30 to 2.32, when converting UCS4 text containing an irreversible character, fails an assertion in the code path and aborts the program, potentially resulting in a denial of service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-29562) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210122-0004/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/TVCUNLQ3HXGS4VPUQKWTJGRAW2KTFGXS/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26923) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in IBM1364, IBM1371, IBM1388, IBM1390, and IBM1399 encodings, fails to advance the input state, which could lead to an infinite loop in applications, resulting in a denial of service, a different vulnerability from CVE-2016-10228. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-27618) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210401-0006/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv feature in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.32, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in the EUC-KR encoding, may have a buffer over-read. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `glibc`. ## References - vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The nameserver caching daemon (nscd) in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.29 through 2.33, when processing a request for netgroup lookup, may crash due to a double-free, potentially resulting in degraded service or Denial of Service on the local system. This is related to netgroupcache.c. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-27645) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/I7TS26LIZSOBLGJEZMJX4PXT5BQDE2WS/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27462)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv program in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.31 and earlier, when invoked with multiple suffixes in the destination encoding (TRANSLATE or IGNORE) along with the -c option, enters an infinite loop when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences, leading to a denial of service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10228) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/03/01/10) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96525) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-10228)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Underflow
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-6096) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-6096) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SPYXTDOOB4PQGTYAMZAZNJIB3FF6YQXI/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/URXOIA2LDUKHQXK4BE55BQBRI6ZZG3Y6/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25620) - [MISC](https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1019) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-dev-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The nameserver caching daemon (nscd) in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.29 through 2.33, when processing a request for netgroup lookup, may crash due to a double-free, potentially resulting in degraded service or Denial of Service on the local system. This is related to netgroupcache.c. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-27645) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/I7TS26LIZSOBLGJEZMJX4PXT5BQDE2WS/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27462)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-dev-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv program in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.31 and earlier, when invoked with multiple suffixes in the destination encoding (TRANSLATE or IGNORE) along with the -c option, enters an infinite loop when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences, leading to a denial of service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10228) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/03/01/10) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96525) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-10228)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-dev-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Underflow
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-6096) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-6096) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SPYXTDOOB4PQGTYAMZAZNJIB3FF6YQXI/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/URXOIA2LDUKHQXK4BE55BQBRI6ZZG3Y6/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25620) - [MISC](https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1019) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-dev-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Reachable Assertion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.30 to 2.32, when converting UCS4 text containing an irreversible character, fails an assertion in the code path and aborts the program, potentially resulting in a denial of service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-29562) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210122-0004/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/TVCUNLQ3HXGS4VPUQKWTJGRAW2KTFGXS/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26923) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6-dev

vulnerabilities.title: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in IBM1364, IBM1371, IBM1388, IBM1390, and IBM1399 encodings, fails to advance the input state, which could lead to an infinite loop in applications, resulting in a denial of service, a different vulnerability from CVE-2016-10228. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-27618) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210401-0006/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6-dev

vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv feature in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.32, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in the EUC-KR encoding, may have a buffer over-read. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `glibc`. ## References - The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-6096) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-6096) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SPYXTDOOB4PQGTYAMZAZNJIB3FF6YQXI/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/URXOIA2LDUKHQXK4BE55BQBRI6ZZG3Y6/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25620) - [MISC](https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1019) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)

The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in IBM1364, IBM1371, IBM1388, IBM1390, and IBM1399 encodings, fails to advance the input state, which could lead to an infinite loop in applications, resulting in a denial of service, a different vulnerability from CVE-2016-10228. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-27618) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210401-0006/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224)

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The nameserver caching daemon (nscd) in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.29 through 2.33, when processing a request for netgroup lookup, may crash due to a double-free, potentially resulting in degraded service or Denial of Service on the local system. This is related to netgroupcache.c. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-27645) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/I7TS26LIZSOBLGJEZMJX4PXT5BQDE2WS/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27462)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Underflow
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-6096) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-6096) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SPYXTDOOB4PQGTYAMZAZNJIB3FF6YQXI/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/URXOIA2LDUKHQXK4BE55BQBRI6ZZG3Y6/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25620) - [MISC](https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1019) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Certificate Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `gnupg2` package. Interaction between the sks-keyserver code through 1.2.0 of the SKS keyserver network, and GnuPG through 2.2.16, makes it risky to have a GnuPG keyserver configuration line referring to a host on the SKS keyserver network. Retrieving data from this network may cause a persistent denial of service, because of a Certificate Spamming Attack. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `gnupg2`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://lists.gnupg.org/pipermail/gnupg-announce/2019q3/000439.html) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K08654551) - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K08654551?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/AUK2YRO6QIH64WP2LRA5D4LACTXQPPU4/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/CP4ON34YEXEZDZOXXWV43KVGGO6WZLJ5/) - [MISC](https://gist.github.com/rjhansen/67ab921ffb4084c865b3618d6955275f) - [MISC](https://twitter.com/lambdafu/status/1147162583969009664) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-08/msg00039.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-13050)

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `gnutls28` package. A flaw was found in gnutls. A use after free issue in client sending key_share extension may lead to memory corruption and other consequences. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `gnutls28`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-20231) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210416-0005/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OSLAE6PP33A7VYRYMYMUVB3U6B26GZER/) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1922276) - [MISC](https://www.gnutls.org/security-new.html#GNUTLS-SA-2021-03-10) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r5d4001031e7790d8c6396c499522b4ed2aab782da87b1a14184793bb@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r5f88bed447742fcc5c47bf1c7be965ef450131914a6e1f85feba2779@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r9cbc69e57276413788e90a6ee16c7c034ea4258d31935b70db2bd158@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rcd70a4c88a47a75fd2d5f3ffb7cee8c2a18c713320bd90fdcb57495f@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rfd5273d72d244178441e6904a2f2b41a3268f569e8092ea0b3b2bb20@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E)
vulnerabilities.name: gnutls28/libgnutls30
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: /bin/sh -c apt-get update -qqy && apt-get install --no-install-recommends -y     bc bison ca-certificates curl gcc git jq libxml2 libtinfo5 libc6-dev libssl-dev     libstdc++6 make openssl python-all-dev python3-dev ssh tzdata wget zip zstd     && apt-get -y clean && apt-get -y autoremove     && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists     && rm -rf /var/cache/apt/archives

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `gnutls28` package. A flaw was found in gnutls. A use after free issue in client_send_params in lib/ext/pre_shared_key.c may lead to memory corruption and other potential consequences. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `gnutls28`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-20232) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210416-0005/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OSLAE6PP33A7VYRYMYMUVB3U6B26GZER/) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1922275) - [MISC](https://www.gnutls.org/security-new.html#GNUTLS-SA-2021-03-10) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r50661d6f0082709aad9a584431b59ec364f9974b63b07e0800230168@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r5d4001031e7790d8c6396c499522b4ed2aab782da87b1a14184793bb@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r5f88bed447742fcc5c47bf1c7be965ef450131914a6e1f85feba2779@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r6ac143ba6dd98bd4bf6bf010d46e56e254056459721ba18822d611f7@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r9cbc69e57276413788e90a6ee16c7c034ea4258d31935b70db2bd158@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rcd70a4c88a47a75fd2d5f3ffb7cee8c2a18c713320bd90fdcb57495f@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf5e1256d870193def4a82ad89ab95e63943a313b5ff0d81aa87e4532@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rfd5273d72d244178441e6904a2f2b41a3268f569e8092ea0b3b2bb20@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: /bin/sh -c apt-get update -qqy && apt-get install --no-install-recommends -y     bc bison ca-certificates curl gcc git jq libxml2 libtinfo5 libc6-dev libssl-dev     libstdc++6 make openssl python-all-dev python3-dev ssh tzdata wget zip zstd     && apt-get -y clean && apt-get -y autoremove     && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists     && rm -rf /var/cache/apt/archives

A use after free issue in client_send_params in lib/ext/pre_shared_key.c may lead to memory corruption and other potential consequences. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `gnutls28`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-20232) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210416-0005/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OSLAE6PP33A7VYRYMYMUVB3U6B26GZER/) - [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1922275) - [MISC](https://www.gnutls.org/security-new.html#GNUTLS-SA-2021-03-10) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r50661d6f0082709aad9a584431b59ec364f9974b63b07e0800230168@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r5d4001031e7790d8c6396c499522b4ed2aab782da87b1a14184793bb@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r5f88bed447742fcc5c47bf1c7be965ef450131914a6e1f85feba2779@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r6ac143ba6dd98bd4bf6bf010d46e56e254056459721ba18822d611f7@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r9cbc69e57276413788e90a6ee16c7c034ea4258d31935b70db2bd158@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rcd70a4c88a47a75fd2d5f3ffb7cee8c2a18c713320bd90fdcb57495f@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf5e1256d870193def4a82ad89ab95e63943a313b5ff0d81aa87e4532@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rfd5273d72d244178441e6904a2f2b41a3268f569e8092ea0b3b2bb20@%3Cissues.spark.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: /bin/sh -c apt-get update -qqy && apt-get install --no-install-recommends -y     bc bison ca-certificates curl gcc git jq libxml2 libtinfo5 libc6-dev libssl-dev     libstdc++6 make openssl python-all-dev python3-dev ssh tzdata wget zip zstd     && apt-get -y clean && apt-get -y autoremove     && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists     && rm -rf /var/cache/apt/archives

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `krb5` package. An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `krb5`. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709) - [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkrb5support0
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: /bin/sh -c apt-get update -qqy && apt-get install --no-install-recommends -y     bc bison ca-certificates curl gcc git jq libxml2 libtinfo5 libc6-dev libssl-dev     libstdc++6 make openssl python-all-dev python3-dev ssh tzdata wget zip zstd     && apt-get -y clean && apt-get -y autoremove     && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists     && rm -rf /var/cache/apt/archives

vulnerabilities.title: Cryptographic Issues
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgcrypt20` package. ** DISPUTED ** In Libgcrypt 1.8.4, the C implementation of AES is vulnerable to a flush-and-reload side-channel attack because physical addresses are available to other processes. (The C implementation is used on platforms where an assembly-language implementation is unavailable.) NOTE: the vendor's position is that the issue report cannot be validated because there is no description of an attack. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `libgcrypt20`. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-12904) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-12904) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/gpg/libgcrypt/commit/a4c561aab1014c3630bc88faf6f5246fee16b020) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/gpg/libgcrypt/commit/daedbbb5541cd8ecda1459d3b843ea4d92788762) - [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T4541) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-07/msg00049.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-12904)
vulnerabilities.name: libgcrypt20

(The C implementation is used on platforms where an assembly-language implementation is unavailable.) NOTE: the vendor's position is that the issue report cannot be validated because there is no description of an attack. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `libgcrypt20`. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-12904) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-12904) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/gpg/libgcrypt/commit/a4c561aab1014c3630bc88faf6f5246fee16b020) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/gpg/libgcrypt/commit/daedbbb5541cd8ecda1459d3b843ea4d92788762) - [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T4541) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-07/msg00049.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-12904)
vulnerabilities.name: libgcrypt20

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libtasn1-6` package. GNU Libtasn1-4.13 libtasn1-4.13 version libtasn1-4.13, libtasn1-4.12 contains a DoS, specifically CPU usage will reach 100% when running asn1Paser against the POC due to an issue in _asn1_expand_object_id(p_tree), after a long time, the program will be killed. This attack appears to be exploitable via parsing a crafted file. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `libtasn1-6`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://gitlab.com/gnutls/libtasn1/issues/4) - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1000654) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-1000654) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-06/msg00009.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-06/msg00018.html) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/105151) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-1000654)
vulnerabilities.name: libtasn1-6

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libxml2` package. A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. This issue is fixed in macOS Big Sur 11.1, Security Update 2020-001 Catalina, Security Update 2020-007 Mojave, macOS Big Sur 11.0.1, iOS 14.2 and iPadOS 14.2, watchOS 7.1, tvOS 14.2. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to code execution. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `libxml2`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-27920) - [MISC](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211928) - [MISC](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211929) - [MISC](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211930) - [MISC](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211931) - [MISC](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT212011)
vulnerabilities.name: libxml2
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: /bin/sh -c apt-get update -qqy && apt-get install --no-install-recommends -y     bc bison ca-certificates curl gcc git jq libxml2 libtinfo5 libc6-dev libssl-dev     libstdc++6 make openssl python-all-dev python3-dev ssh tzdata wget zip zstd     && apt-get -y clean && apt-get -y autoremove     && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists     && rm -rf /var/cache/apt/archives

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libxml2` package. A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, tvOS 13.4.8, watchOS 6.2.8, iCloud for Windows 7.20, macOS Catalina 10.15.6, Security Update 2020-004 Mojave, Security Update 2020-004 High Sierra. Processing maliciously crafted XML may lead to an unexpected application termination or arbitrary code execution. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `libxml2`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-9926) - [MISC](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211288) - [MISC](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211289) - [MISC](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211290) - [MISC](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211291) - [MISC](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211295)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libxml2` package. GNOME project libxml2 v2.9.10 has a global buffer over-read vulnerability in xmlEncodeEntitiesInternal at libxml2/entities.c. vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `openssh` package. The client side in OpenSSH 5.7 through 8.4 has an Observable Discrepancy leading to an information leak in the algorithm negotiation. This allows man-in-the-middle attackers to target initial connection attempts (where no host key for the server has been cached by the client). ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `openssh`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-14145) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200709-0004/) - [MISC](https://anongit.mindrot.org/openssh.git/commit/?id=b3855ff053f5078ec3d3c653cdaedefaa5fc362d) - [MISC](https://docs.ssh-mitm.at/CVE-2020-14145.html) - [MISC](https://github.com/openssh/openssh-portable/compare/V_8_3_P1...V_8_4_P1) - [MISC](https://github.com/ssh-mitm/ssh-mitm/blob/master/ssh_proxy_server/plugins/session/cve202014145.py) - [MISC](https://www.fzi.de/en/news/news/detail-en/artikel/fsa-2020-2-ausnutzung-eines-informationslecks-fuer-gezielte-mitm-angriffe-auf-ssh-clients/) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/12/02/1)
vulnerabilities.name: openssh/openssh-client

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `pcre3` package. In PCRE 8.41, the OP_KETRMAX feature in the match function in pcre_exec.c allows stack exhaustion (uncontrolled recursion) when processing a crafted regular expression. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `pcre3`. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-11164) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-11164) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/07/11/3) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99575) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-11164)
vulnerabilities.name: pcre3/libpcre3

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `pcre3` package. libpcre in PCRE before 8.43 allows a subject buffer over-read in JIT when UTF is disabled, and \X or \R has more than one fixed quantifier, a related issue to CVE-2019-20454. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `pcre3`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-20838) - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-20838) - [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT211931) - [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212147) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2020/Dec/32) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Feb/14) - [MISC](https://bugs.gentoo.org/717920) - [MISC](https://www.pcre.org/original/changelog.txt) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)
vulnerabilities.name: pcre3/libpcre3

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `pcre3` package. libpcre in PCRE before 8.44 allows an integer overflow via a large number after a (?C substring. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `pcre3`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-14155) - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-14155) - [CONFIRM](https://about.gitlab.com/releases/2020/07/01/security-release-13-1-2-release/) - [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT211931) - [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212147) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2020/Dec/32) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Feb/14) - [MISC](https://bugs.gentoo.org/717920) - [MISC](https://www.pcre.org/original/changelog.txt) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)
vulnerabilities.name: pcre3/libpcre3

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `pcre3` package. In PCRE 8.41, the OP_KETRMAX feature in the match function in pcre_exec.c allows stack exhaustion (uncontrolled recursion) when processing a crafted regular expression. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `pcre3`. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-11164) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-11164) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/07/11/3) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99575) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-11164)
vulnerabilities.name: pcre3/libpcre3

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `pcre3` package. libpcre in PCRE before 8.43 allows a subject buffer over-read in JIT when UTF is disabled, and \X or \R has more than one fixed quantifier, a related issue to CVE-2019-20454. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `pcre3`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-20838) - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-20838) - [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT211931) - [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212147) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2020/Dec/32) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Feb/14) - [MISC](https://bugs.gentoo.org/717920) - [MISC](https://www.pcre.org/original/changelog.txt) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.title: HTTP Request Smuggling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `python3.8` package. The package python/cpython from 0 and before 3.6.13, from 3.7.0 and before 3.7.10, from 3.8.0 and before 3.8.8, from 3.9.0 and before 3.9.2 are vulnerable to Web Cache Poisoning via urllib.parse.parse_qsl and urllib.parse.parse_qs by using a vector called parameter cloaking. When the attacker can separate query parameters using a semicolon (;), they can cause a difference in the interpretation of the request between the proxy (running with default configuration) and the server. This can result in malicious requests being cached as completely safe ones, as the proxy would usually not see the semicolon as a separator, and therefore would not include it in a cache key of an unkeyed parameter. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `python3.8`. ## References - vulnerabilities.name: python3.8/libpython3.8-stdlib

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-29921
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `python3.8` package. Improper input validation of octal strings in Python stdlib ipaddress 3.10 and below allows unauthenticated remote attackers to perform indeterminate SSRF, RFI, and LFI attacks on many programs that rely on Python stdlib ipaddress. IP address octects are left stripped instead of evaluated as valid IP addresses. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `python3.8`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-29921) - [MISC](https://bugs.python.org/issue36384) - [MISC](https://docs.python.org/3/library/ipaddress.html) - [MISC](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/63298930fb531ba2bb4f23bc3b915dbf1e17e9e1/Misc/NEWS.d/3.8.0a4.rst) - [MISC](https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/12577) - [MISC](https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/25099) - [MISC](https://github.com/sickcodes) - [MISC](https://github.com/sickcodes/security/blob/master/advisories/SICK-2021-014.md) - [MISC](https://python-security.readthedocs.io/vuln/ipaddress-ipv4-leading-zeros.html) - [MISC](https://sick.codes/sick-2021-014)

The package python/cpython from 0 and before 3.6.13, from 3.7.0 and before 3.7.10, from 3.8.0 and before 3.8.8, from 3.9.0 and before 3.9.2 are vulnerable to Web Cache Poisoning via urllib.parse.parse_qsl and urllib.parse.parse_qs by using a vector called parameter cloaking. When the attacker can separate query parameters using a semicolon (;), they can cause a difference in the interpretation of the request between the proxy (running with default configuration) and the server. vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-29921
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `python3.8` package. Improper input validation of octal strings in Python stdlib ipaddress 3.10 and below allows unauthenticated remote attackers to perform indeterminate SSRF, RFI, and LFI attacks on many programs that rely on Python stdlib ipaddress. IP address octects are left stripped instead of evaluated as valid IP addresses. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `python3.8`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-29921) - [MISC](https://bugs.python.org/issue36384) - [MISC](https://docs.python.org/3/library/ipaddress.html) - [MISC](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/63298930fb531ba2bb4f23bc3b915dbf1e17e9e1/Misc/NEWS.d/3.8.0a4.rst) - [MISC](https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/12577) - [MISC](https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/25099) - [MISC](https://github.com/sickcodes) - [MISC](https://github.com/sickcodes/security/blob/master/advisories/SICK-2021-014.md) - [MISC](https://python-security.readthedocs.io/vuln/ipaddress-ipv4-leading-zeros.html) - [MISC](https://sick.codes/sick-2021-014)
vulnerabilities.name: python3.8/libpython3.8-stdlib

vulnerabilities.title: HTTP Request Smuggling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `python3.8` package. The package python/cpython from 0 and before 3.6.13, from 3.7.0 and before 3.7.10, from 3.8.0 and before 3.8.8, from 3.9.0 and before 3.9.2 are vulnerable to Web Cache Poisoning via urllib.parse.parse_qsl and urllib.parse.parse_qs by using a vector called parameter cloaking. When the attacker can separate query parameters using a semicolon (;), they can cause a difference in the interpretation of the request between the proxy (running with default configuration) and the server. This can result in malicious requests being cached as completely safe ones, as the proxy would usually not see the semicolon as a separator, and therefore would not include it in a cache key of an unkeyed parameter. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `python3.8`. ## References - vulnerabilities.name: python3.8/libpython3.8-dev

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-29921
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `python3.8` package. Improper input validation of octal strings in Python stdlib ipaddress 3.10 and below allows unauthenticated remote attackers to perform indeterminate SSRF, RFI, and LFI attacks on many programs that rely on Python stdlib ipaddress. IP address octects are left stripped instead of evaluated as valid IP addresses. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `python3.8`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-29921) - [MISC](https://bugs.python.org/issue36384) - [MISC](https://docs.python.org/3/library/ipaddress.html) - [MISC](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/63298930fb531ba2bb4f23bc3b915dbf1e17e9e1/Misc/NEWS.d/3.8.0a4.rst) - [MISC](https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/12577) - [MISC](https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/25099) - [MISC](https://github.com/sickcodes) - [MISC](https://github.com/sickcodes/security/blob/master/advisories/SICK-2021-014.md) - [MISC](https://python-security.readthedocs.io/vuln/ipaddress-ipv4-leading-zeros.html) - [MISC](https://sick.codes/sick-2021-014)
vulnerabilities.name: python3.8/libpython3.8-dev

vulnerabilities.title: HTTP Request Smuggling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `python3.8` package. The package python/cpython from 0 and before 3.6.13, from 3.7.0 and before 3.7.10, from 3.8.0 and before 3.8.8, from 3.9.0 and before 3.9.2 are vulnerable to Web Cache Poisoning via urllib.parse.parse_qsl and urllib.parse.parse_qs by using a vector called parameter cloaking. When the attacker can separate query parameters using a semicolon (;), they can cause a difference in the interpretation of the request between the proxy (running with default configuration) and the server. This can result in malicious requests being cached as completely safe ones, as the proxy would usually not see the semicolon as a separator, and therefore would not include it in a cache key of an unkeyed parameter. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `python3.8`. ## References - vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-29921
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `python3.8` package. Improper input validation of octal strings in Python stdlib ipaddress 3.10 and below allows unauthenticated remote attackers to perform indeterminate SSRF, RFI, and LFI attacks on many programs that rely on Python stdlib ipaddress. IP address octects are left stripped instead of evaluated as valid IP addresses. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `python3.8`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-29921) - [MISC](https://bugs.python.org/issue36384) - [MISC](https://docs.python.org/3/library/ipaddress.html) - [MISC](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/63298930fb531ba2bb4f23bc3b915dbf1e17e9e1/Misc/NEWS.d/3.8.0a4.rst) - [MISC](https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/12577) - [MISC](https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/25099) - [MISC](https://github.com/sickcodes) - [MISC](https://github.com/sickcodes/security/blob/master/advisories/SICK-2021-014.md) - [MISC](https://python-security.readthedocs.io/vuln/ipaddress-ipv4-leading-zeros.html) - [MISC](https://sick.codes/sick-2021-014)

vulnerabilities.title: HTTP Request Smuggling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `python3.8` package. The package python/cpython from 0 and before 3.6.13, from 3.7.0 and before 3.7.10, from 3.8.0 and before 3.8.8, from 3.9.0 and before 3.9.2 are vulnerable to Web Cache Poisoning via urllib.parse.parse_qsl and urllib.parse.parse_qs by using a vector called parameter cloaking. When the attacker can separate query parameters using a semicolon (;), they can cause a difference in the interpretation of the request between the proxy (running with default configuration) and the server. This can result in malicious requests being cached as completely safe ones, as the proxy would usually not see the semicolon as a separator, and therefore would not include it in a cache key of an unkeyed parameter. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `python3.8`. ## References - IP address octects are left stripped instead of evaluated as valid IP addresses. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `python3.8`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-29921) - [MISC](https://bugs.python.org/issue36384) - [MISC](https://docs.python.org/3/library/ipaddress.html) - [MISC](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/63298930fb531ba2bb4f23bc3b915dbf1e17e9e1/Misc/NEWS.d/3.8.0a4.rst) - [MISC](https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/12577) - [MISC](https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/25099) - [MISC](https://github.com/sickcodes) - [MISC](https://github.com/sickcodes/security/blob/master/advisories/SICK-2021-014.md) - [MISC](https://python-security.readthedocs.io/vuln/ipaddress-ipv4-leading-zeros.html) - [MISC](https://sick.codes/sick-2021-014)

vulnerabilities.title: HTTP Request Smuggling
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `python3.8` package. The package python/cpython from 0 and before 3.6.13, from 3.7.0 and before 3.7.10, from 3.8.0 and before 3.8.8, from 3.9.0 and before 3.9.2 are vulnerable to Web Cache Poisoning via urllib.parse.parse_qsl and urllib.parse.parse_qs by using a vector called parameter cloaking. When the attacker can separate query parameters using a semicolon (;), they can cause a difference in the interpretation of the request between the proxy (running with default configuration) and the server. This can result in malicious requests being cached as completely safe ones, as the proxy would usually not see the semicolon as a separator, and therefore would not include it in a cache key of an unkeyed parameter. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `python3.8`. ## References - vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `sqlite3` package. This issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Big Sur 11.0.1, watchOS 7.0, iOS 14.0 and iPadOS 14.0, iCloud for Windows 7.21, tvOS 14.0. A remote attacker may be able to cause a denial of service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `sqlite3`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-9991) - [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT211846) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2020/Dec/32) - [MISC](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211843) - [MISC](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211844) - [MISC](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211847) - [MISC](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211850) - [MISC](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211931) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)
vulnerabilities.name: sqlite3/libsqlite3-0
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: /bin/sh -c apt-get update -qqy && apt-get install --no-install-recommends -y     bc bison ca-certificates curl gcc git jq libxml2 libtinfo5 libc6-dev libssl-dev     libstdc++6 make openssl python-all-dev python3-dev ssh tzdata wget zip zstd     && apt-get -y clean && apt-get -y autoremove     && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists     && rm -rf /var/cache/apt/archives

An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5, iTunes 12.10.7 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.2, iCloud for Windows 7.19. vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2020-13529
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. An exploitable denial-of-service vulnerability exists in Systemd 245. A specially crafted DHCP FORCERENEW packet can cause a server running the DHCP client to be vulnerable to a DHCP ACK spoofing attack. An attacker can forge a pair of FORCERENEW and DCHP ACK packets to reconfigure the server. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `systemd`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13529) - [MISC](https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1142)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. systemd 242 changes the VT1 mode upon a logout, which allows attackers to read cleartext passwords in certain circumstances, such as watching a shutdown, or using Ctrl-Alt-F1 and Ctrl-Alt-F2. This occurs because the KDGKBMODE (aka current keyboard mode) check is mishandled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20839) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/9725f1a10f80f5e0ae7d9b60547458622aeb322f) - [GitHub PR](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/pull/12378) - [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/systemd/+bug/1803993) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190530-0002/) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108389) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20839)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

This occurs because the KDGKBMODE (aka current keyboard mode) check is mishandled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20839) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/9725f1a10f80f5e0ae7d9b60547458622aeb322f) - [GitHub PR](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/pull/12378) - [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/systemd/+bug/1803993) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190530-0002/) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108389) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20839)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2020-13529
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. An exploitable denial-of-service vulnerability exists in Systemd 245. A specially crafted DHCP FORCERENEW packet can cause a server running the DHCP client to be vulnerable to a DHCP ACK spoofing attack. An attacker can forge a pair of FORCERENEW and DCHP ACK packets to reconfigure the server. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `systemd`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13529) - [MISC](https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1142)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Open Redirect
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `wget` package. GNU Wget through 1.21.1 does not omit the Authorization header upon a redirect to a different origin, a related issue to CVE-2018-1000007. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:20.04` `wget`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-31879) - [MISC](https://mail.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-wget/2021-02/msg00002.html)
vulnerabilities.name: wget
vulnerabilities.dockerfileInstruction: /bin/sh -c apt-get update -qqy && apt-get install --no-install-recommends -y     bc bison ca-certificates curl gcc git jq libxml2 libtinfo5 libc6-dev libssl-dev     libstdc++6 make openssl python-all-dev python3-dev ssh tzdata wget zip zstd     && apt-get -y clean && apt-get -y autoremove     && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists     && rm -rf /var/cache/apt/archives
